oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Does transportation of young dairy calves impact their health and welfare?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Renaud, David
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: non-replacement
calf welfare
legislation
transit
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The transportation of young dairy calves has come under in足creased scrutiny due to new legislation in several countries and research highlighting the challenges associated with this prac足tice. Studies have consistently shown that transportation, espe足cially long-distance transportation, can lead to higher levels of disease and negatively impact calf welfare. To overcome chal足lenges associated with transportation, it is critical to consider the following strategies: 1) reduce the duration of transport; 2) transport calves at an older age; 3) offer a milk meal before or during transit; and 4) ensure calves are fit for transport. Implementing these practices could help reduce the impact of transport and improve the health and well-being of young dairy calves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; Vol. 58 No. 58 (2024): 2024 AABP Annual Conference Proceedings; 54-56
